author: Harper Lee
quote: You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view.

author: George Orwell
quote: War is peace. Freedom is slavery. Ignorance is strength.

author: Jane Austen
quote: I could easily forgive his pride if he had not mortified mine.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
quote: So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past.

author: J.D. Salinger
quote: Don’t ever tell anybody anything. If you do, you start missing everybody.

author: Herman Melville
quote: Call me Ishmael.

author: Aldous Huxley
quote: Words can be like X-rays if you use them properly—they’ll go through anything.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
quote: There is nothing like looking, if you want to find something.

author: Ray Bradbury
quote: It was a pleasure to burn.

author: Charlotte Brontë
quote: I am no bird; and no net ensnares me: I am a free human being with an independent will.

author: Emily Brontë
quote: Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same.

author: Paulo Coelho
quote: And, when you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
quote: What is essential is invisible to the eye.

author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
quote: Pain and suffering are always inevitable for a large intelligence and a deep heart.

author: Leo Tolstoy
quote: All happy families are alike; each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way.

author: Mary Shelley
quote: Beware; for I am fearless, and therefore powerful.

author: Bram Stoker
quote: We learn from failure, not from success!

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: The only way to get rid of a temptation is to yield to it.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: You have power over your mind – not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.

author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
quote: The mystery of human existence lies not in just staying alive, but in finding something to live for.

author: Kurt Vonnegut
quote: So it goes.

author: Victor Hugo
quote: Even the darkest night will end and the sun will rise.

author: Albert Camus
quote: I opened myself to the gentle indifference of the world.

author: Charles Dickens
quote: It was the best of times, it was the worst of times.

author: Cormac McCarthy
quote: You forget what you want to remember, and you remember what you want to forget.
